Let $K/F$ be a field extension and $\kappa \in K$ be algebraic over $F$.
The *minimal polynomial for $\kappa$ over $F$* is a monic polynomial
$m(x)\in F[x]$ such that $m(\kappa)=0$ and, for any other polynomial
$f(x) \in F[x]$ with $f(\kappa)=0$, $m$ divides $f$. Note that, for any
element $\kappa$ that is algebraic over $F$, ; moreover, because of the
monic condition, it exists uniquely.
